snippet.title: How the 5:2 diet rules could save you cash
snippet.content:
The 5:2 diet has been used by millions of people across the globe to shed kilos, but now its key principals could save you cash. Those on the 5:2 eating plan slash their daily energy intake to five or six hundred calories for two days each week. Money experts told 9NEWS these same rules can be applied to spending, restricting shopping to five out of seven days. "It's not having to go without, it's about being smarter," Michelle House from Rich Living said today. Ms House recommended using a smart phone app, such as Track My Spend, to be less inclined to mindlessly "tap and go". She also advised on money "fasting" days to: Ms House also said it was important to set a goal for how much you want to save, and what for.
